message.content:
Step 1: Calculate the Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio  
• From the cash flow statement, the Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = –5,714,107.45  
• From the income statement, the Net Profit = –1,669,849.77  
• Ratio = (–5,714,107.45)/(–1,669,849.77) = 5,714,107.45/1,669,849.77 ≈ 3.42  

Step 2: Calculate the Current Assets Turnover Ratio  
• Use the Total Revenue from the income statement: 6,920,513.79  
• Average Current Assets = (Beginning Current Assets + Ending Current Assets) / 2  
  = (8,000,000.00 + 7,664,945.72) / 2  
  = 15,664,945.72 / 2 ≈ 7,832,472.86  
• Ratio = 6,920,513.79 / 7,832,472.86 ≈ 0.88  

Step 3: Calculate the Quick Ratio  
• Quick Assets = Ending Current Assets – Inventory  
  = 7,664,945.72 – 3,900,000.00  
  = 3,764,945.72  
• Current Liabilities (Ending) = 2,736,025.72  
• Quick Ratio = 3,764,945.72 / 2,736,025.72 ≈ 1.38  

Thus, the results are:

{
  "solution": {
    "Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio": "3.42",
    "Current Assets Turnover Ratio": "0.88",
    "Quick Ratio": "1.38"
  }
}
